options.optionText: I have been diagnosed with metastatic breast cancer (also known as advanced or stage IV breast cancer). I'm willing to answer additional questions about myself and my experience with metastatic breast cancer.
I haven't been diagnosed with metastatic breast cancer, but I want to stay informed about the Metastatic Breast Cancer Project by joining the email list.

questions.questionText: When were you first diagnosed with breast cancer?
When were you first diagnosed with metastatic breast cancer (also known as advanced or stage IV breast cancer)?
At any time, was your breast cancer found to be hormone receptor positive (HR+, ER+ and/or PR+)?
At any time, was your breast cancer found to be HER2 positive (HER2+)?
At any time, was your breast cancer found to be triple negative (e.g, NOT ER+, PR+ or HER2+)?
At any time, were you diagnosed with inflammatory breast cancer?
Since your diagnosis with metastatic breast cancer, have you been on any of your cancer therapies for more than 2 years?
Please list the cancer therapies you have been on for more than 2 years, if you know their names.

Have any of your therapies worked extraordinarily well - made your cancer disappear completely (resulting in no evidence of disease, NED) or resulted in a dramatic reduction in tumor size - for any period of time?
Please list the cancer therapies that have worked extraordinarily well, if you know their names.
If you have had an extraordinary response to therapy, tell us more about it.
When was your most recent biopsy of your cancer?
Tell us anything else you would like to about yourself or your cancer.
In what year were you born?

questions.questionText: Which categories describe you? Select all that apply. Note, you may select more than one group.
Do you consider yourself to be mixed race, that is belonging to more than one racial group, such as Mestizo, Mulatto or some other mixed race, or not?
Do you consider yourself to be Afro-Latino, Afro-Hispanic, Afro-Caribbean, or not? (An Afro-Latino or Afro-Hispanic is a Latino or Hispanic with black African ancestry)

Do you consider yourself to be indigenous or Native American (such as Purepecha, Mixteco, Zapoteco, Nahua, Maya, Tzotzil, Taino, Arawak, Quiche, Aymara, Quechua, Kwichua, Mapuche, Guarani, or some other indigenous or Native American origin), or not?
What is your gender identity? Select all that apply
What sex were you assigned at birth?
How did you hear about the MBCproject?
You can work with me to arrange a sample of blood to be drawn at my physician’s office, local clinic, or nearby lab facility.

You can request my stored tissue samples from my physicians and the hospitals and other places where I received my care, perform (or collaborate with others to perform) gene tests on the samples, and store the samples until this research study is complete.
